summary:
Scientist with 8 years of experience in preclinical testing & validation of mechanism of action for different drug modalities (Small molecules, bispecific antibodies, ADCs, mRNA liposomal nano particles and scFVS) in oncology and immunology. In depth knowledge in cancer biology  and autoimmunity indications. 
Skilled in development of molecular biology assays, immunology assays, cancer biology assays, multi-color flow cytometry, in vivo experiments, design and synthesis of scFv based therapeutics, synthesis of liposomal nanoparticles. Underwent training in R programming and exploration of biological data using R (TCGA analysis and RNA-seq analysis).

currentPositions.description:
Scientist in Discovery Immunology dept, BMS. 
Developed and executed immune cell assay development and in vitro testing of biologics for two projects in matrixed teams. 
- Screened bispecifics for efficacy of autoreactive immune cell depletion and toxicity in vitro. 
- Characterized human PBMC stimulation models for proliferation of specific immune subsets using multi-color flow cytometry analysis. 
- Tested effects of bispecific antibodies on cytokine secretion in vitro using MSD analysis. 
- Contributed to development of exploratory project testing effects of ADCs in autoimmune disease. 
- Developed and characterized human PBMC based models for testing efficacy of ADCs using cell-based assays.
- Designed and executed assays for understanding bystander effects of ADCs in immune cells using multi-color flow cytometry. 
- Communicated critical decisional data to team leads through presentations/reports.
currentPositions.title: Senior Associate Scientist

projects.description:
Pancreatic cancer is a uniformly lethal disease with a dismal survival rate of only 9%. It is often diagnosed at advanced stages - locally advanced or distant metastasis, when the disease has already progressed. The standard of care therapy provided for patients at this stage includes a combination of chemotherapeutic agents namely gemcitabine and abraxane, which only marginally improves the survival rate. Most tumors are chemoresistant due to two important factors - Presence of intrinsically chemoresistant stem-like cancer cells that survive and proliferate following withdrawal of chemotherapy and the dense, fibrotic architecture of tumors that reduces blood vessel patency in tumors and as a result, makes tumors inaccessible to chemotherapeutic agents. 
We are studying a chemokine signaling pathway - CXCR4-CXCL12's role in maintenance of proliferation of stem-like cancer cells and also maintenance of fibrotic networks using a novel biotherapeutic based inhibitor of CXCR4. Our overall hypothesis is that inhibition of CXCR4 in improves chemotherapy efficacy and prolongs survival in pancreatic cancer. Our goal is to introduce a novel combination chemotherapy regimen to pancreatic cancer patients in the clinic to improve therapeutic efficacy and survival.
projects.title: Developing novel therapeutics to reduce chemoresistance in Pancreatic cancer

projects.description: The goal of the project was to find drugs inhibiting pathways involved in stem cell proliferation, for the purpose of maintaining quiescence in muscle stem cells. These cells, also known as satellite stem cells are important for the repair and regeneration of muscle tissue during injury. However, little is known about how these adult stem cells, in a state of cell-cycle arrest, are able to efficiently proliferate and localize to injured tissues in crisis. Therefore, our goal was to establish an ex vivo system of stem cells on their muscle fibers and maintain these cells in a state of non-proliferation or quiescence. Our approach was to use BDM, 2-D-Butane Dionemonoxime, a known Rho/ROCK inhibitor that arrests actin-myosin contractility and cell cycle progression in satellite cells.
projects.title: Maintenance of stem cell quiescence in muscle stem cells using BDM

projects.description:
HNF1A is an important transcription factor whose network is upregulated in cancer stem-like cells in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma. Genetic depletion of HNF1A results in decrease in tumor growth as well as cancer stem-like cell burden in patient derived pancreatic tumors in mouse models. Our goal is target HNF1A using an epigenetic approach, by target Bromodomain and extra terminal domain proteins (BRD) in pancreatic cancer. BRDs are epigenetic reader proteins that promote transcription of oncogenic transcription factors, including HNF1A. We hypothesize that targeting these proteins using chemical small molecule inhibitors, BET inhibitors decreases tumor growth and cancer stem-like cell burden in pancreatic tumors. 
This study impacts how BET inhibitors, which are currently in various phases of clinical trials will be utilized to improve prognosis in pancreatic cancer
projects.title: Targeting HNF1A-dependent stemness and tumor growth in pancreatic cancer using BET inhibitors

headline: Senior Associate Scientist, Discovery Immunology

message.text: تشرفت وسعدت اليوم بتكريمي من قبل الرئيس التنفيذي ل #تجمع_مكة_المكرمة_الصحي سعادة الدكتور حاتم العمري بعد فوزي بالميدالية الذهبية بمعرض جنيف الدولي للاختراعات ٢٠٢٤.

الحمدلله دائماً وأبداً
‏بكل فخر .. وفي إنجاز عالمي تم حصولي على الميدالية الذهبية 🥇في معرض جنيف الدولي 2024 للاختراعات  بمشاركة ( ١٠٠٠مخترع ) يمثلون (٤٠ )دولة حول العالم.

🇸🇦💚 إنجاز عالمي لـ #تجمع_مكة_المكرمة_الصحي بحصد ميداليات عدة في معرض جنيف الدولي للاختراعات 2024 🥇🥈🥉

🔹 الدكتور توفيق سراج يبتكر حلًا رائدًا لعلاج الخلع المتكرر لمفصل الكتف، مُحققًا الميدالية الذهبية مع مرتبة الشرف. 🥇

🔹 الدكتورة مريم تركستاني تبرز في توظيف تقنية النانو لنقل العلاج الكيماوي مباشرةً إلى الخلايا السرطانية، مُتوجة بالذهب. 🥇

🔹 الأستاذة إبتسام كريري تطوّر ثلاجة ذكية لبنوك الدم، نالت الميدالية الفضية. 🥈

🔹 الدكتور أحمد الشريف يُحدث ثورة بجهاز تنفسي ذكي، مكتسبًا الفضة. 🥈

🔹 الدكتور أحمد الذبياني يحمي خصوصية المرضى بسترة غطاء مرنة، مُحرزًا البرونز. 🥉

إنجازات تضاف إلى قائمة النجاحات السعودية على الساحة العالمية، مؤكدة ريادة المملكة في الابتكار والعلوم. 🌍👏

#إنجازات_سعودية
 #معرض_جنيف #ابتكار


🇸🇦💚 A Global Achievement for #MeccaHealthCluster by Securing Multiple Medals at the 2024 Geneva International Invention Fair 🥇🥈🥉

🔹 Dr. Tawfiq Seraj innovates a leading solution for recurrent shoulder dislocation, earning a gold medal with honors. 🥇

🔹 Dr. Mariam Turkistani excels in using nanotechnology to directly deliver chemotherapy to cancer cells, crowned with gold. 🥇

🔹 Professor Ibtisam Kiriri develops a smart refrigerator for blood banks, awarded the silver medal. 🥈

🔹 Dr. Ahmed Al-Sharif revolutionizes with a smart respiratory device, acquiring silver. 🥈

🔹 Dr. Ahmed Al-Dhubyani protects patient privacy with a flexible cover vest, clinching bronze. 🥉

These achievements add to Saudi Arabia’s list of successes on the global stage, affirming the kingdom’s leadership in innovation and science. 🌍👏

#SaudiAchievements #GenevaExpo #Innovation

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم 

﴿يَا أَيَّتُهَا النَّفْسُ الْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ ارْجِعِي إِلَى رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَرْضِيَّةً فَادْخُلِي فِي عِبَادِي وَادْخُلِي جَنَّتِي﴾

بقلوب مؤمنة راضية بقضاء الله وقدره، انتقل إلى رحمة الله تعالى .
والدي / عبدالعزيز معروف جان تركستاني 

وإِنَّا لِلّهِ وَإِنَّا إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعونَ

اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْهُ وَعَافِهِ وَاعْفُ عَنْهُ وَأَكْرِمْ نُزُلَهُ وَوَسِّعْ مُدْخَلَهُ وَاغْسِلْهُ بِالْمَاءِ وَالثَّلْجِ وَالْبَرَدِ وَنَقِّهِ مِنَ الذُّنُوبِ والْخَطَايَا كَمَا يُنَّقى الثَّوْبَ الأَبْيَضَ مِنَ الدَّنَسِ.

commentary.text: الله يرحمه ويغفرله ويسكنه فسيح جناته
Usamah Ahmed Jan أسامة أحمد جان جزاك الله خير
Mohammad Abdulhakim Mousa MD جزاك الله خير
محمد بن أحمدالدين جزاك الله الف خير
Sohaib I. Maghrabi جزاك الله خير
